CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 60 BM) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC 70 BM) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to "Material Name" presented as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PC 60 BM |
| PC 70 BM |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 1-4 To achieve high power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) , electrondonor polymers should have the following desirable characteristics : ( i ) good absorption spectral overlap with the solar spectrum , ( ii ) optimal energy level alignment with respect to electron - acceptor fullerene derivatives ( typically [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 60 BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71butyric acid methyl ester ( PC 70 BM ) ) to facilitate efficient exciton separation , ( iii ) formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer , and ( iv ) provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| PCEs | Power conversion efficiencies |
| good absorption spectral overlap | Good overlap between the absorption spectrum of the polymer and the solar spectrum |
| optimal energy level alignment | Optimal alignment of the energy levels of the electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM or PC 70 BM) with respect to the polymer |
| efficient exciton separation | Efficient separation of excitons formed in the polymer-fullerene blend |
| nanoscale interpenetrating network | Formation of a nanoscale interpenetrating network of the polymer and fullerene domains inside the photoactive layer |
| effective charge transport carriers | Provision of effective charge transport carriers toward the electrodes |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| good absorption spectral overlap | Good overlap between the absorption spectrum of the polymer and the solar spectrum |
| optimal energy level alignment | Optimal alignment of the energy levels of the electron-acceptor fullerene derivatives (PC 60 BM or PC 70 BM) with respect to the polymer |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property":

* PCEs (Power conversion efficiencies)
* efficient exciton separation
* nanoscale interpenetrating network
* effective charge transport carriers

These entities are either referring to the performance of the material (PCEs), the process of exciton separation (efficient exciton separation), the structure of the material (nanoscale interpenetrating network), or the function of the material (effective charge transport carriers). They do not directly describe the value of a material property.
